channel.title: Webclient won't work for some people
channel.description:
So. i have this problem with my webclient. when some of my friends go there, it loads just fine. but for others it won't just stops at "Fletching updats 98 (19) "
what could the problem be?

item.title: Webclient won't work for some people
item.dc:creator: @chris100184 chris100184
item.description:
@chris100184 wrote:

marcbob:

Some of the others touched on issues I’ve had before. Jar the client with jdk 6 and it should be fine. If not post back and I’ll continue to try and help

That seems to have fixed it. Thanks :]

Read full topic
item.source: Webclient won't work for some people

item.title: Webclient won't work for some people
item.dc:creator: @chris100184 chris100184
item.description:
@chris100184 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:516154”][quote author=chris100184 link=topic=634413.msg4283228#msg4283228 date=1365994850]

Jar your client with an older jdk.

(Ppl who use an older java then you jarred it with, might have some problems to run it)

Sadly that’s not the problem. they get to like fletching update 98 (19) and it just stops.
[/quote]
What?
What you described in the first post, and what you described in this one are way different.[/quote]

Yeah sorry, i was not fully awake when i wrote that. i’ll go edit it

Read full topic

item.source: Webclient won't work for some people

item.title: Webclient won't work for some people
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You can run Java 6 code on Java 7, but cannot run Java 7 code on Java 6. The most likely cause as pointed out is that your users are using an older Java version which isn’t compatible to run the newer version. I suggest you either compile with a lower Java version or ask your users to upgrade.

Read full topic
item.source: Webclient won't work for some people

item.title: Webclient won't work for some people
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“oldschool-scape, post:4, topic:516154”]Jar your client with an older jdk.

(Ppl who use an older java then you jarred it with, might have some problems to run it)[/quote]
This could be it too.
I always did 2-3 versions lower.
I think Java 7 have a message that is sent when trying to run a java app with outdated Java though.

Read full topic
